flow.descriptionCdata:
9e5d929a-ecd5-4370-b425-bc3fd5cf2d7e.0e1d61e6-6b84-4952-87a7-9d2a82a0dcd8.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
9e5d929a-ecd5-4370-b425-bc3fd5cf2d7e.6aa269e8-39bf-4cbd-a618-a427fbedc855.description=
Removes "eve\:" and "t\:" namespace from a given Tosca XML cloud infrastructure topology.

Inputs\:
    (required)
    infrastructureTopology - string of a cloud infrastructure in Tosca XML.

Results\:
    modifiedXml (primary) - Given topology of Tosca XML without namespace information.

Responses\:
    success - The flow completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The flow completed unsuccessfully.
9e5d929a-ecd5-4370-b425-bc3fd5cf2d7e.841d880c-d0a4-420b-88d0-f7cac2574287.prompt=HostName\: 9e5d929a-ecd5-4370-b425-bc3fd5cf2d7e.861c24e0-5960-4cf8-91f3-cedc6ee0672c.prompt=Enter your TOSCA XML String 9e5d929a-ecd5-4370-b425-bc3fd5cf2d7e.922cbebb-c356-4876-80d8-bf761e7ec05b.description=
This operation is used to send a smtp email.
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: true. 
    readReceipt - The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false. 
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false. 
    attachments - A delimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - If SMTP authentication is needed, the password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-32, EUC-JP, ISO-2022-JP, Shift_JIS, Windows-31J.
Default value\: UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: quoted-printable, base64, 7bit, 8bit, binary, x-token.
Default value\: quoted-printable (or Q Encoding).
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments.
Default value\: ','
 
Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.

Note\:
1. For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
2. For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
9e5d929a-ecd5-4370-b425-bc3fd5cf2d7e.c0e34977-7ac4-48ed-a6fb-ecb8e4da05e5.description=
This operation uses WMI to attempt to create a remote process on target machine and run the command. 

Inputs\:
    host - Hostname or ip address of the target machine.
    command - The command you want to execute. Special characters\: '<', '>', '(', ')', '&' need to be escaped using the caret ('^') character.  The only exception to this rule is when the '>' character is used to redirect output.
    currentDirectory - The directory from which the command will be executed.
    user - Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank).
    password - Password of the user.
    outputPath - Network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default the path will have to be changed on Windows 2000 systems.
    characterSet - The character encoding used to write the batch file that will be remotely executed by the operation. Unicode character encodings may not be supported for this input (utf-8, utf-16, etc.).  Support for unicode encodings depends on target system capabilities.  By default this encoding will also be used to read the command output that is redirected to temporary files.  If the command output is expected to be of different encoding, specify the different encoding in the "outputCharacterSet" input.  
Default value\: The encoding of the operating system where is RAS installed.
Examples\: ibm437, shift_jis
    outputCharacterSet - The character encoding used to read the command output that was redirected to temporary files.  Only need to specify this input if the output of the command is known to be of a different character encoding.  As an example\: the "wmic" command returns utf-16 encoded output.
Examples\: ibm437, shift_jis, utf-8, utf-16
    timeout - The number of seconds before assuming the remote process is no longer functional. After the timeout has expired the remote process and all child processes will be terminated.
Default value\: 600
    useDelegation - This input must be added by the user in order to be used. If set to "true" the operation will use the "Delegate" impersonation level and the "Kerberos" authentication protocol. If "false", empty or missing the operation will use "Impersonate" for the impersonation level and the default authentication protocol (which is NTLM).
Values\: true, false
Default\: false
    debugPath - This input must be added by the user in order to be used. If set to "true", an additional result field named "commandPassed" is returned and it contains the command that executes the script. For more information on the purpose of this input, see the "Notes" section.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It is the value from WMI for starting the process (not the exit value of the process).
    processID - The process id of the remote process.
    processReturnCode - The return code of the remote process.
    stdOut - Standard output from the remote process.
    stdErr - Standard error from the remote process.

Responses\:
    success - Remote process successfully launched and has completed executing.
    failure - Unable to start remote process.

Notes\: 
1. Internally this operation creates a temporary batch file with the following content\:

cmd /c " [command] 2> err.tmp 1> out.tmp "
echo %ERRORLEVEL% > ret.tmp

After the script is executed, the operation will read the files\: err.tmp (standard error), out.tmp (standard output) and ret.tmp (return code). Finally the operation deletes all the temporary files.
The command that executes the script can be accesed by adding a new input\: debugPath with the value\: "true"

2. List of possible encoding names (Support for the encoding may depend on the version or language of the RAS OS)\:
Encoding Name\:	Description\:
IBM437		OEM United States
DOS-720		Arabic (DOS)
ibm737		Greek (DOS)
ibm775		Baltic (DOS)
ibm850		Western European (DOS)
ibm852		Central European (DOS)
IBM855		OEM Cyrillic
ibm857		Turkish (DOS)
IBM00858		OEM Multilingual Latin I
IBM860		Portuguese (DOS)
ibm861		Icelandic (DOS)
DOS-862		Hebrew (DOS)
IBM863		French Canadian (DOS)
IBM864		Arabic (864)
IBM865		Nordic (DOS)
cp866		Cyrillic (DOS)
ibm869		Greek, Modern (DOS)
shift_jis		Japanese (Shift-JIS)
gb2312		Chinese Simplified (GB2312)
ks_c_5601-1987	Korean
big5		Chinese Traditional (Big5)
utf-16		Unicode
unicodeFFFE		Unicode (Big-Endian)
utf-7		Unicode (UTF-7)
utf-8		Unicode (UTF-8)
utf-32		Unicode (UTF-32)
utf-32BE		Unicode (UTF-32 Big-Endian)
Johab		Korean (Johab)
us-ascii		US-ASCII
koi8-r		Cyrillic (KOI8-R)
euc-jp		Japanese (EUC)
EUC-CN		Chinese Simplified (EUC)
euc-kr		Korean (EUC)
hz-gb-2312		Chinese Simplified (HZ)
GB18030		Chinese Simplified (GB18030)
9e5d929a-ecd5-4370-b425-bc3fd5cf2d7e.dd17b19c-ac24-4eab-a9d6-bca478a0eb95.description=
This operation takes a reference to a XML (in the form of a String) and a specified XPath Query is run against the XML. This returns the results in a form of a delimited list. 
The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org).

Inputs\:
    xml - The XML in the form of a String.
    xpathQuery - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. See the examples in Notes section below.
    delimiter- The delimiter used to separate values in the returnResult list. 
Default value\: ','.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. Contains the results in a form of a delimited list. If multiple XPaths are defined then this will add the delimiter between each value. There is no final delimiter.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Notes\:
1. The XPath Query can be specified as a single query in a format similiar to the following\:
/employees/employee[@id\="3"]/*[name()\="name" or name()\="jobDescription" or name()\="salary" or name()\="managerId"]/text()

This would return the following results\:
Goofy,tester,$50,1

2. If more than one XPath query needs to be specified, populate xpathQuery using the XPath concat function. Here is a sample of a xpathQuery value using XPath concat function\:
concat(/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/name/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/jobDescription/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/managerId/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/salary/text())

The output using the concat xpathQuery input would return the following results\:
Donald Duck,Lead Coder,1,$50

The examples above use the following XML string value\:


  
    Mickey Mouse
    Chief
    $100
    
  
  
    Donald Duck
    Lead Coder
    $50
    1
  
  
    Goofy
    tester
    $50
    1
  
  
    Pluto
    Coder - grade 1
    $25
    2
9e5d929a-ecd5-4370-b425-bc3fd5cf2d7e.e82f22a5-39d7-4f07-9832-0bbd157ef0bf.description=
Runs the Ping command locally. 

Input Parameters\:
    targetHost - The target host to ping
    packetSize - The size of the ping packet
    packetCount - The number of packets to send. 
    timeout - The timeout in miliseconds for the Local Ping operation. Default is 90000.
    ipVersion - IP version forced to the ping command executed on the target host. For Windows -4 or -6 parameters will be added.On Linux will be used ping or ping6. For Solaris -A inet or -A inet6 parameters will be added. For empty string the operation will decide what format to use if targetHost is an ip literal; if targetHost is given as a hostname default 'ping' command will be used on each operating system.
Values\: 4, 6, '' (empty string without quotes).
Default\: '' (empty string without quotes).

Responses\:
    success - The command was executed successfully
    failure - The command could not be executed

Returns\:
    packetsSent - The number of packets sent
    packetsReceived - The number of packets received
    percentagePacketsLost - The percentage of packets lost
    transmissionTimeMin - The minimum time taken for transmitting the packet
    transmissionTimeMax - The maximum time taken for transmitting the packet
    transmissionTimeAvg - The average time taken for transmitting the packet
    returnResult - The raw output of the command
    returnCode - The return code from the executed command
    error - the STDERR of the command
flow.name: Callout getIPAddress and install ISS
